suncertify.gui.client

Class UrlyBirdClientGuiUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.gui.client.UrlyBirdClientGuiUtils

  • public class UrlyBirdClientGuiUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This singleton class contains the utility methods for the client GUI. It allows the UrlyBirdClientGui to only contain code for the displaying of the UI Components.
    Since:
    15/05/2014
    Author:
    Luke GJ Potter

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static UrlyBirdClientGuiUtils getInstance()
        The singleton constructor.
        Returns:
        An instance of UrlyBirdClientGuiUtils.

      • ensurePropertiesAreValid

        public void ensurePropertiesAreValid(UrlyBirdApplicationMode urlyBirdApplicationMode)
        Ensures that the properties in the properties file are correct for the GUI to function in the current application mode.

        If the application is started in standalone mode, it checks that the database file, supplied in the properties file, exists. If the database file does not exist, the User is asked for it's location.

        If the application is started in networked mode, it checks that the RMI host and port are correct, by attempting to connect to the server. Should the connection attempt fail, the client aborts.

        Parameters:
        urlyBirdApplicationMode - The mode that the application is running in.

      • receiveCsrNumber

        public java.lang.String receiveCsrNumber()
        Asks the GUI User for their CSR Number by launching a JOptionPane.showInputDialog window. It performs checks on the CSR number that is entered to ensure that the CSR number is 8 digits.
        Returns:
        The correctly formatted CSR number.

      • retrieveCorrectDao

        public DatabaseAccessDao retrieveCorrectDao(UrlyBirdApplicationMode urlyBirdApplicationMode)
        Returns a local or remote DatabaseAccessDao instance, depending on the Application Mode.
        Parameters:
        urlyBirdApplicationMode - The mode of the application.
        Returns:
        A DatabaseAccessDaoRemote instance, if the application is set to NETWORKED_CLIENT. A DatabaseAccessDaoLocal instance, if the application is set to STANDALONE_CLIENT.
